report_title: Industry Research: Auto Glass Repair & Replacement Franchises
executive_summary: The Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry has experienced volatile conditions over the five years to 2022. Broken or damaged windows in cars and trucks often must be repaired fairly quickly because the damaged glass may interfere with the safety of the driver and the vehicle. Additionally, drivers can be ticketed for windshield cracks in many states. While the costs of these repairs are often covered by auto insurance providers, which helps shield the industry from sudden declines in its customers' disposable income levels, the industry still tends to benefit from a stronger economy as individuals are less inclined to put off repairs when they feel confident in the economy. Thus, industry revenue growth decelerated in 2020 due to the adverse economic effects of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, as well as the decline in total vehicle miles driven due to travel restrictions and work-from-home designations. Comparatively, auto glass repairs cannot be deterred as readily as other discretionary auto services, preventing a decline. In all, industry revenue is expected to increase an annualized 3.9% to $224.4 million over the five years to 2022, including 3.3% growth in 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the five-year period, competition within the industry has intensified. Franchisees offer price discounting to attract customers away from other establishments, often at the expense of average industry profit. While nonfranchise glass repair shops have to invest heavily in promoting their services, franchises benefit from co-op advertising on national and regional media for a comparatively smaller cost. However, long-term shifts to more-diversified product offerings and independent branding continued during the period. As a result, industry profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, has declined to 8.0% in 2022 from 14.4% in 2017.

Over the five years to 2027, industry revenue is expected to increase an annualized 1.3% to $239.4 million. Growth early in the period can be contributed to economic improvements following the pandemic. Additionally, as more cars are sold as consumer confidence rises, more consumers will be at risk of costlier collisions, helping industry operators. Notably, the industry will likely be characterized by advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) in the outlook period. Although ADAS prevent vehicle collisions, reducing demand for the industry, they also present an opportunity for costlier repair services to industry operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Demand for auto glass repair services can be negatively affected by unexpected declines in automobile accidents. With the US economy anticipated to improve over the five years to 2027, growth in car sales will likely result in an increase of the number of new cars with advanced safety features on the road. According to the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety, two major causes of collisions are driver distraction and fatigue. While these causes are inevitable, new car features, such as crash-avoidance technologies, introduce alert systems and automatic breaking to help drivers remain alert and avoid crashes. These features may keep more windshields intact than industry operators would like.

In previous years, the focus of automotive safety technology was on crash control (e.g., seat belts, airbags and sturdier windshields). This focus is anticipated to be honed in over the next five years, hurting industry operators. A renewed emphasis is expected to be placed on value-added safety features, such as better lighting systems for night driving, strategic sensor placement to detect cars within side-view blind spots and sensors and cameras embedded within the vehicle aimed at preventing car damage when parking and driving. Additionally, ADAS features and sensors are expected to be integrated into more cars in the outlook period. Cars manufactured with ADAS feature cameras and sensors throughout the vehicle on the front and back windshields and side-view mirrors. While the majority of ADAS repairs are currently made at dealerships, it is likely auto glass repair shops will make these repairs moving forward. While this presents an opportunity for the industry in the form of higher-margin, costlier repairs, it also poses a risk, as a greater number of cars with ADAS will reduce the total number of cars requiring repairs overall. Nonetheless, over the next five years, the total number of motor vehicle registrations is forecast to increase at an annualized rate of 1.6% to 308.5 million vehicles.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The largest market segment for the Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry is private households and individual consumers.
Commercial and business clients form the second-largest segment, demanding auto glass repair and replacement services. Clients include cab and rental car companies.

Government agencies and nonprofits comprise 3.6% of the industry's revenue. Market share for this segment is steady, as government vehicles include emergency fleets, school transport and police cars, which generally require glasswork at a higher rate due to their functions.

Transport and shipping clients account for 0.9% of revenue in 2022; while these industries are large and their fleets need maintenance, these vehicles have relatively little glass on their bodies, and glass products remain one of the least-advanced components of such vehicles.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer preferences hinge on industry prices and individuals' disposable income levels. Consumers with higher disposable income are more likely to demand the industry's services, while those with lower incomes typically delay or forgo glass repairs entirely if the glass damage is not severe enough to inhibit driving or disqualify a driver from receiving a state inspection sticker. Consumer demand for industry services also depends on convenience, including hours of operation and whether the franchisee offers mobile services.

The likelihood of independent mechanics seeking out new franchise auto glass repair and replacement shop opportunities is largely based on the market popularity of specific brands. When a brand's popularity is growing, potential franchisees are more likely to invest. After investigating the growth potential of a specific auto glass repair and replacement shop brand, potential franchisees consider regional demographics, the number of citizens on the road and the income levels of drivers who might purchase industry services. High franchise fees, advertising and royalty costs and total initial investment may shift investment potential away from one brand to another.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The service-based nature of the Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry limits the opportunity for international trade.

The industry does not report any revenue from imports and exports of auto glass. While trade does not apply to the industry, operators display some degree of globalization through the ownership of foreign holdings and purchases of glass from foreign manufacturers.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration provides baseline standards on all auto glass installed in the United States. The glass in a vehicle plays a significant role in the vehicle's structural integrity and the driver's safety. Therefore, incorrectly repaired or replaced glass can make the vehicle susceptible to structural failures in collisions.

Industry operators are also subject to laws and regulations relating to environmental protection from toxins and human health and safety. Various regulatory agencies, including the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency and other federal, state and local agencies have jurisdiction over the operation of repair facilities.

The Auto Glass Safety Council, which is an accredited American National Standards Institute standards development organization, develops North America's glass replacement guidelines and standards. The National Windshield Repair Association has compiled a list of standards for industry operators.

Operators benefit from anti-steering regulation, which prohibits insurers from suggesting or recommending that a claimant select a different auto repair dealer. That said, many insurance companies use networks to process glass claims, and unless the consumer specifies a shop of their choice, the network will assign one from their list.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Parent companies and franchisors overseeing the franchises within the Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry will often encourage potential franchisees to open up new locations in expanding markets. Many parent companies encourage entry to the industry by offering incentives that effectively remove many of the barriers to entry that come with opening a small business.
Some standard barriers can still deter entry. For example, the short-term total cost of investment for opening a new shop may discourage new franchisees.

Multi-unit owners of franchise locations carry a competitive advantage over new franchise owners because of their established investments with the parent company and access to a wider geographic area of customers.
There is significant competition among franchised companies to obtain suitable establishment locations, which has increased the cost of prime sites.

factors_decreased_barrier: Parent companies offer incentives to remove many barriers to entry for new franchisees.

basis_points.basis_description: Repair shops primarily compete on price and quality of service.

Increasing ownership of used and certified pre-owned vehicles has limited the industry's success in recent years; consumers who drive used vehicles typically do not invest the same amount of money and care into their used cars, thereby prompting more franchise operators to offer special discounts and promotions to sell their services.

Pricing is also connected to energy and input costs, such as the price of glass and production efficiency. Technological innovations and securing contracts for competitively priced inputs are central to companies hoping to achieve a competitive edge.

Quality of service is an extremely important component of competition in the industry. Generating repeat clients and favorable feedback through word-of-mouth and online reviews is key to developing a steady customer base.

Industry operators provide high quality service by offering repair and replacement work on windshield and windows of all conditions and types and by providing convenience through extended operating hours and mobile service options.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 3 players account for over 90% market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: The Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry has a high market share concentration, with the largest three players accounting for more than 90.0% of industry revenue in 2022.

This high concentration for the three largest players has a lot to do with the sheer number of establishments each hold, aided by the general nature of franchising and the niche that this industry holds even among auto repair operators.
Nonetheless, as more companies have entered the industry over the five years to 2022, market concentration has fallen from highs achieved during the period.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry is highly labor-intensive; thus, wages account for the second-largest expense industry operators incur.
Purchases account for the largest expense for Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry operators and are projected to account for 9.1% of revenue in 2022.
Average depreciation costs are low, accounting for 1.9% of revenue in 2022. These charges vary slightly depending on the structure of the franchise.

Franchisees are expected to spend 1.8% of revenue on marketing and advertising. Advertising campaigns can be funded via in part or in whole by either the franchisor or the franchisee, with most advertising campaigns geared largely to target local markets through radio and print.
Most franchises have an initial franchise fee, which generally ranges from $10,000 to $30,000. Rent is anticipated to account for 4.5% of industry revenue in 2022.
In 2022, utility costs including electricity and power for equipment is anticipated to account for 1.1% of industry revenue.

Other costs include various transportation costs among mobile and on-call repair franchises and combine to account for 44.9% of revenue in 2022. Additionally, franchising fees are accounted for in this segment, boosting its relative share of revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry exhibits a low level of capital intensity. For every $1.00 spent on labor, the average franchise invests an estimated $0.07 in capital in 2022.

The majority of capital investment comprises initial start-up costs to open a new franchise location. Capital costs vary for each location and each franchisee, with most franchisors offering different financing options based on the capital requirements of each new establishment. Regardless, this industry relies most heavily labor. In 2022, wages are expected to consume 28.6% of industry revenue.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Fluctuations in demand and input costs
volatility_points.volatility_description: The industry's level of volatility reflects variations in the level of demand from households, insurance companies and commercial clients. Fluctuations in input costs also contribute to the industry's revenue volatility; increases in the price of crude oil, diesel fuel and plastic resin will increase costs for both consumers in need of repairs and franchises that perform auto repairs.

While moderately volatile, the industry has experienced nearly continuous growth during the five-year period. Operators experienced their strongest year in 2019 as revenue grew 7.5%. Meanwhile, revenue growth was more subdued in 2020, as the onset of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic and the ensuing economic fallout somewhat reduced demand for repairs.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Auto Glass Repair and Replacement Franchises industry has not contended with any significant technological disruption. While the technology involved in automobiles has changed rapidly over the five years to 2022, auto glass and repair methodologies and tools have not changed significantly.

Windshield replacement services are completed by certified technicians by removing side moldings and wipers, removing the damaged windshield, applying urethane adhesives and primers around the windshield frame and affixing the new windshield. In most cases, new adhesive technologies have enabled drivers to safely leave the shop about an hour after the new windshield has been installed.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales reliant on the overall health of the United States?
FAQs.answer: As the economy improves motorists are likely to seek more specialized auto repair services. Furthermore, an improved economy means more discretionary spending which increases demand for window tints and other auto glass custom work.

FAQs.question: What percent of revenue is assigned to advertising?
FAQs.answer: About 2.0% of revenue is assigned to advertisement. This is because Auto Glass Repair franchises benefit from co-op marketing. Advertising for one location is advertising for all as each franchise pools resources.

FAQs.question: How does your company competitively price your services in areas where similar services are widely available?
FAQs.answer: Over the past five years, auto glass franchises have had increased competition from full auto body shops. They've also faced a trend of consumers fixing auto glass themselves. This has pushed a strong movement of franchises offering services for discounted prices.

FAQs.question: Is your company conveniently located in high-traffic areas to maximize visibility?
FAQs.answer: Sometimes the company is the traffic. A growing trend in the industry is for franchisees to operate their establishment on the road in trucks with the necessary equipment. This helps the industry gain visisbility and access to customers.

FAQs.question: Is your company investing in new technology to improve internal processes?
FAQs.answer: Technological advancements to the repair of minor windshield scratches and cracks have made the service so simple that most automobile insurance policies will provide comprehensive coverage and may even waive deductibles for drivers who require minor repairs.

FAQs.question: What point-of-sale systems does your company use to reduce labor costs?
FAQs.answer: Unfortunately for industry companies, labor is very intensive in the industry. As of now, no major advancements have helped reduce the need for labor or its cost.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Various regulatory agencies, including the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, the Environmental Protection Agency and other federal, state and local agencies have jurisdiction over the operation of repair facilities.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration provides baseline standards on all auto glass installed in the United States. The glass in a vehicle plays a significant role in the vehicle's structural integrity and the driver's safety. Faulty repairs are costly and could hurt company margins.

FAQs.question: How do you keep operating costs down while still providing high levels of service?
FAQs.answer: Mobile services and smaller operated franchises have been a key method of reducing wage costs, which account for more than a quarter of industry costs.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company have to replace its equipment?
FAQs.answer: Materials used in repair such as plastic and resins, are often only able to be used for one repair each. Therefore purchase of materials is a constant for industry operators.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets? Are your facilities in a convenient location for consumers?
FAQs.answer: It is important for industry establishments to be conveniently located near key customer markets.

FAQs.question: How can you increase your business expertise? Do you monitor shipping trends for forecasting purposes?
FAQs.answer: It is critical to have experience and skills in managing and operating all aspects of a small business to achieve financial success.

FAQs.question: How much education is required for your employees? Do you offer ongoing training?
FAQs.answer: Franchises greatly benefit from hiring employees who possess extensive technical knowledge of repair services and end user needs.

FAQs.question: How will this affect your company? How do you generate demand during periods of low demand?
FAQs.answer: In general, an increased number of vehicles on the road leads to more potential for accidents and, regardless, a bigger pool of potential customers for industry operators.

FAQs.question: How does increased motor vehicle use affect demand for your company? Do you specialize in post-accident repairs?
FAQs.answer: The amount of driving is a direct contributor to demand for auto glass repair services, as the aggregate number of miles driven in the United States will increase the likelihood of accidents.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? Do you offer higher-margin services?
FAQs.answer: The level of per capita disposable income may influence how quickly a damaged window is repaired, especially when window damage is minor or cosmetic.
